text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.
WHEAT SALE - The Taiwan Flour Mills Association bought 52,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat in two shipments at a tender on Wednesday.

- Tunisia on Wednesday bought 125,000 tonnes of Canadian, U.S. or European wheat for shipment between July and September at prices that include $176.50 per tonne with freight for July, grain traders said.

SOYMEAL SALE - El Salvador bought 9,000 tonnes U.S. soymeal on Tuesday under the PL-480 export program for June 1-15 delivery, its U.S. export agent said. The meal, maximum five percent or less at buyers' option, was purchased from Continental Grain at $341.49 a tonne, FOB Mississippi River, the agent said.

CORN AND SOY TENDER - State-owned Taiwan Sugar Corp will tender on Friday for a combined shipment comprising 18,000 tonnes of U.S. corn and 12,000 tonnes of U.S. soybeans for June delivery, traders said.
SOYBEAN TENDERS - South Korea's state-run Agricultural and Fishery Marketing Corp has invited offers for 40,000 tonnes of No.1 soybeans. Bidding will close on May 15.

- Japanese buyers will be picking up U.S. soybeans for July shipment this week due to firmer quotes seen on U.S. Gulf/Japan freight rates, traders said. "End-users returned to the market since last week and are watching the freight cost across the Pacific Ocean," a soybean trader at a major trade house in Japan said.

BARLEY TENDERS - The Cyprus Grain Commission on Wednesday invited tenders for the supply of 18,000 tonnes of maize and 25,000 tonnes of barley for June shipment. The tender closing date is May 20, it said.
- Iran will tender on May 19 to import 100,000 tonnes of optional-origin feed barley for shipment in August, European grain traders said.
FLOUR TENDER - Yemen seeks 150,000 tonnes of soft wheat flour on May 13 for August/October shipment. The flour was expected to come from the EU, U.S., or both.

WHEAT TENDER - Sri Lanka seeks 100,000 tonnes HRW wheat in two lots of 50,000 tonnes. Tenders close on May 16. The first shipment was for May 22-June 5 if from U.S., Canada, Europe or Argentina, and June 10-19 from Australia or Saudi Arabia. The second lot was for June 16-25 if from U.S., Canada, Continent or Argentina, and June 30-July 9 from Australia or Saudi Arabia.

LENTIL TENDER - Syria's General Establishment for Cereal Processing and Trade offered 16,000 tonnes of lentils for export. An international call for prices set May 20 as the final date to receive bids and confirmation made on May 21.
RICE TENDER - Jordan seeks 15,000 tonnes of medium grain camolina type rice on May 21 for June delivery

MARKET TALK - Sri Lanka received authorization to buy $10 million worth of U.S. wheat under Public Law 480, the U.S. Agriculture Department said. The authorization provides for about 55,000 tonnes of wheat, grade U.S. No. 2 or better, the agency's Foreign Agricultural Service said.

... Jordan has sold 80,000 tonnes of U.S. Number 3 yellow corn or better to local traders ahead of a move to end a state monopoly on imports of the commodity and allow private firms to handle it, traders said on Wednesday.
